summary: The "Linking Access to Spur Technology for Agriculture Connectivity in Rural Environments Act of 2025" (LAST ACRE Act) amends the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 to establish a "Last Acre Program." This program provides grants and loans to providers to expand high-speed internet access to unserved and underserved agricultural land, supporting precision agriculture. The bill defines various terms, outlines application processes, sets cybersecurity requirements, and mandates annual reporting. The bill also contains provisions for data collection on broadband adoption by agricultural producers.
